case_vignette: A 34-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with moderate right wrist pain after falling on her outstretched hand. She has numbness in the 3 medial digits. The patient has no known previous medical conditions. Her family history is not pertinent, and she currently takes no medications. Physical examination shows her blood pressure is 134/82 mm Hg, the respirations are 14/min, the pulse is 87/min, and the temperature is 36.7°C (98.0°F). When asked to make a fist, the patient is able to flex only the lateral 2 digits. Tapping the anterior portion of her wrist elicits tingling in the medial 3 digits. The patient is taken to get an X-ray.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis for this patient’s injury?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have moderate pain in my right wrist after I fell, and I'm feeling numbness in the middle three fingers of my hand.
When did you fall and experience this pain and numbness?
I fell today.
Did you hear a snap or feel your wrist bone move out of place during the fall?
No, I didn't hear a snap or feel the bone move out of place.
Is there any visible swelling, bruising, or discoloration around your wrist or hand?
No, there isn't any visible swelling, bruising, or discoloration.
Do you have any difficulty moving your fingers or wrist, or is it just pain and numbness?
I can't flex my middle three fingers when I try to make a fist.
Is the sensation of numbness constant, or does it come and go?
The numbness seems to be constant.
Do you have any pre-existing conditions affecting your nerves or muscles, or have you had similar symptoms in the past?
No, I have no known previous medical conditions and haven't had similar symptoms before.
Have you taken any medication or done any first aid since the fall?
No, I haven't taken any medications or done any first aid.
Do you have any weakness in your arm, or is the issue isolated to your wrist and fingers?
It seems isolated to my wrist and fingers; I haven't mentioned any arm weakness.
Final Diagnosis: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome as a result of the trauma from the fall.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient presents to the clinic with moderate pain in their right wrist after a fall, along with numbness in the middle three fingers of their hand. They did not hear a snap or feel the bone move out of place, and there is no visible swelling, bruising, or discoloration. The patient is unable to flex their middle three fingers when attempting to make a fist, and the numbness is constant. The patient has no known previous medical conditions and has not experienced similar symptoms before. They have not taken any medications or administered first aid. The symptoms seem isolated to the wrist and fingers, with no mention of arm weakness.
trial_0.vignette_frq: Distal radius fracture with acute carpal tunnel syndrome.
trial_0.singleturn_frq: **Final Diagnosis:** Right wrist fracture with possible median nerve injury.

I'm experiencing moderate pain in my right wrist after I fell on it and there's numbness in my thumb, index, and middle fingers.

It just happened recently before coming to the emergency department.

I can only bend my ring and little fingers into a fist; I can't bend the other fingers.

Final Diagnosis: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome exacerbation likely due to the trauma from the fall.
